messages.message: PSA: The `Webpacked Tests / webpacked-tests` GitHub action is officially merge-blocking, and all tests in the `webpacked` directory will be skipped in our Jenkins pipeline.
This is great :raised_hands: do we see a performance improvement compared to when they run in Jenkins?

such fast execution! :sonic: :blob_excited:

(for both Xindi's implementation of the Github action, and the actual Github action run!)

Hi Xindi
Two of my PR (#1 (https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/72069), #2 (https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/72081)) are blocked on this check, where no status is being returned. Is this due to these new set of change?
@abhitaker thanks for reporting! Looking into this

~@abhitaker would you mind rebasing your PR against the latest master? The GH should only run if any files under `webserver/shared/src/js/webpacked/**` are changed in the PR~
nvm, i don't think it would fix it. Looks like GH action that's merge blocking need to always report status... fix is wip.
Merged! Ty @Paul H, for the quick reviews! Seems like we need to rebase master get the fix applied to the PRs

blahh... how many trial and errors do I need to get this working :sobbadobbasob:? The fix PR actually skips the test for all PRs (the condition autocompleted by cursor was incorrect)

This should fix it for real now. Tested with 2 commits, one changes non-webpacked files, and the other changes just webpacked files.
https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/72141

Also try to fix the Cypress GH. I noticed that we always launch crafting sandboxs and users/orgs even if there are no affected Cypress tests
